channel.title: Homeio on Emily Cibelli
channel.description: Recent content in Homeio on Emily Cibelli

item.description: From 2009-2018, I was a researcher in linguistics, specializing in: phonetics (the study of perception and production of speech sounds), psycholinguistics (the study of real-time language processing, and how language interacts with cognitive processes), and neurolinguistics (the study of the structure and function of the brain as it affects language use). This page is an overview of some of my primary projects during that time. You can find a full list of my published work here.

PERSONAL PROFILE Data analyst and speech scientist specializing in quantitative and computational projects, with domain expertise in linguistics and cognitive science. EMPLOYMENT HISTORY Senior data analyst, Ingenuity Inc. (November 2018 - present) Maintain database of 600+ public schools and 1400+ non-profit organizations specializing in arts education in the city of Chicago, including programming, course offerings, personnel, and cross-organization networking connections Conduct regular analyses of arts education offerings and programs to support CPS district strategic initiatives, internal development and professional learning activities, and policy initiatives in the city of Chicago and state of Illinois Provide ad-hoc research reports and statistical analyses for non-profits working in the school system Develop custom applications to efficiently display data and provide reports to stakeholders Lecturer, ViaX Education (August - December 2018, January 2020 - present)

item.title: About me
item.description: I was raised in a small Jersey town (exit 151), a location which provided me with a view of the Manhattan skyline, a rich inventory of American English vowels, and enough pizzerias to incite war. After distinguishing myself through hardy athletic pursuits and participating in musical groups that expanded my cultural horizons, I left the Garden State for college. While at Wellesley, I studied cognitive and linguistic sciences, and got my start in research with labs on and off campus.
